Förslaget rör stöd till civilssamhällsorganisationen CenterUA. Projekt är i linje med den svenska regeringens regionala resultatstrategi 2014-2020. Projekt kompletterar och ger synlighet till annat arbete för utveckling av det civila samhället i Ukraina.
Insatsen inriktar sig mot ett av de största hindren i genomförandet av reformer - avsaknaden av en bred offentlig dialog och övergripande strategi för problemlösning. Besluten är ofta splittrade och tar inte hänsyn till de viktigaste intressenternas åsikter.
Frågan om medborgarnas delaktighet i beslut, förvaltning och kontroll över användningen av offentliga medel är särskilt relevant i Ukraina som har stora budgetunderskott. Effektiv förvaltning av offentliga finanser och regeringens ansvar för fördelning och användning av budgetmedel är de viktigaste frågorna för att bygga en relation av förtroende och förståelse mellan regeringen och medborgarna.
Standardrisker för insatsen är medelhöga / höga. De högsta riskerna är kopplade till finansiell kontroll, upphandling, korruption samt möjligheterna att uppnå hållbara resultat. Ambassaden kommer att godkänna årlig budget samt arbetsplan. Sidas upphandlingsregler kommer att användas.
Den svenska ambassaden väntar på inkommandet av en revision för insatsen 10518.
Aktivitetsperioden är 2017/03/01 - 2018/02/28. Avtalsperioden är 2017/03/01 - 2018/10/31.

The proposal concerns support for the civil society organization CenterUA. Projects are in line with the Swedish Government's regional performance strategy 2014-2020. Projects complement and provide visibility to other work for the development of civil society in Ukraine.
The initiative focuses on one of the biggest obstacles to implementing reforms - the absence of a broad public dialogue and overall strategy for problem solving. The decisions are often fragmented and do not take into account the views of the main stakeholders.
The question of citizens' involvement in decision-making, management and control over the use of public funds is particularly relevant in Ukraine with major budget deficits. Effective management of public finances and the government's responsibility for allocating and using budget funds are the most important issues for building a relationship of trust and understanding between government and citizens.
Standard risk for the contribution is medium / high. The highest risks are linked to financial control, procurement, corruption and the ability to achieve sustainable results. The Embassy will approve the annual budget and work plan. Sida's procurement rules apply.
The Swedish Embassy is waiting for the receipt of an audit for the 10518.
The activity period is 2017/03/01 - 2018/02/28. The contract period is 2017/03/01 - 2018/10/31

description.narrative: During the project cycle, the CSO managed to reach all the set goals and objectives. Specifically: "ZminyTy" came to be a two-stage national policy tour that gathered the suggestions of the country’s most active communities regarding the problems of healthcare, education and electoral reforms, implementing control over public finance expenditure, and public access to decision-making. Green paper on Citizens Engagement in the Process of Elaboration and Adoption of Strategic Decisions at local level was prepared and presented to public in September 2018, after the start of a new political The document was prepared based on the positions of stakeholder groups in all regions of Ukraine that were collected via public consultations and standardized expert interviews. Its content was publicly and privately discussed with civic activists, local authorities and NGO representatives in all regional centres. Representatives of districts and territorial communities were also invited. The green paper on citizens engagement in the process of elaboration and adoption of strategic decisions proposed a set of changes to the national and local legislation to advocate for, hence no further policy documents are deemed necessary on the access to decision making process. Green paper on Controlling the Use of Public Fund is the result of our 10-month work at the national and regional levels, numerous public consultations and interviews with different stakeholders, including economists, scientists, representatives of national and local state bodies about the reasons why there is such a lack of effective control over the use of public resources, gaps and problems in governing control of public finances, and the options for fixing these As a result, CenterUA has developed a policy brief “On efficient planning of local budgets: the system of control” for professionals working with public funds on the regional level. The Ministry of Finance declared an intention to use the findings provided in analytical reports to reform public finances spending’s Relevant documents were due for development by the Ministry of Finance in the second half of 2018.
